Tornado activity:

Palmetto-area historical tornado activity is slightly above Florida state average. It is 30% greater than the overall U.S. average.

On 10/31/1958, a category F3 (max. wind speeds 158-206 mph) tornado 0.2 miles away from the Palmetto city center injured 4 people and caused between $5000 and $50,000 in damages.

On 4/4/1966, a category F4 (max. wind speeds 207-260 mph) tornado 30.7 miles away from the city center killed 11 people and injured 530 people and caused between $5,000,000 and $50,000,000 in damages.

Earthquake activity:

Palmetto-area historical earthquake activity is significantly above Florida state average. It is 90% smaller than the overall U.S. average.

On 9/10/2006 at 14:56:08, a magnitude 5.9 (5.9 MB, 5.5 MS, 5.8 MW, Class: Moderate, Intensity: VI - VII) earthquake occurred 265.0 miles away from Palmetto center

On 10/24/1997 at 08:35:17, a magnitude 4.9 (4.8 MB, 4.2 MS, 4.9 LG, Depth: 6.2 mi, Class: Light, Intensity: IV - V) earthquake occurred 376.9 miles away from the city center

On 3/31/1992 at 14:59:39, a magnitude 3.8 (3.8 MB, Depth: 3.1 mi, Class: Light, Intensity: II - III) earthquake occurred 220.7 miles away from Palmetto center

On 5/6/2018 at 16:47:09, a magnitude 4.6 (4.6 MB, Depth: 6.2 mi) earthquake occurred 374.3 miles away from Palmetto center

On 11/22/1974 at 05:25:55, a magnitude 4.7 (4.7 MB) earthquake occurred 399.4 miles away from Palmetto center

On 6/23/2016 at 17:20:29, a magnitude 3.8 (3.8 ML) earthquake occurred 255.4 miles away from Palmetto center

Magnitude types: regional Lg-wave magnitude (LG), body-wave magnitude (MB), local magnitude (ML), surface-wave magnitude (MS), moment magnitude (MW)

2003 - 2018 National Fire Incident Reporting System (NFIRS) incidents

According to the data from the years 2003 - 2018 the average number of fires per year is 109. The highest number of fires - 168 took place in 2010, and the least - 41 in 2003. The data has a rising trend.

When looking into fire subcategories, the most reports belonged to: Outside Fires (45.9%), and Mobile Property/Vehicle Fires (26.5%).
